p: Regarding the socio-demographic factors associated with the transmission of the sub-epidemic B versus G in the PT-naive cohort, there were significant differences between the two sub-epidemics for age, gender, risk of transmission, residence in Lisbon, and CD4 count in the univariate analyses, while in the multivariate analyses younger age (Odds Ratio (OR): 0.83 for every increase of 10 years ( 10-years), 95% Confidence interval: 0.79–0.89, p<0.0001), male (OR: 2.66, 2.28–3.09, p<0.0001) and living in Lisbon (OR: 1.44, 1.25–1.66, p<0.0001) were significantly associated with subtype B infections.
